metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: Jesus, who was our purchase price at the gates of hell

cognitieve_implicaties: Humanity is a commodity owned by a dark power
theologische_implicaties: God must satisfy a debt to free humanity
ethische_implicaties: The believer is no longer their own; they are 'bought'
onbedoelde_consequenties: Suggests Hell/Satan has a legal right to human souls that God must respect

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Common in evangelical hymnody, though the 'gates of hell' adds a spatial-military nuance.

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: hiding tenant and a searching Landlord

cognitieve_implicaties: Humanity occupies space that belongs to God
theologische_implicaties: Sin is a breach of a residency contract
ethische_implicaties: Accountability for how one 'maintains' the world
onbedoelde_consequenties: God as an impersonal or demanding property owner

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: A fresh, relatable re-imagining of the Genesis 3 narrative.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher rapidly shifts between Juridical (Treason), Economic (Purchase Price), and Relational (Parent/Child) domains. While these are standard in Christian orthodoxy, the transition from 'Negotiations' to 'Medical Serum' happens without cognitive scaffolding.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: A diplomat operates on cold, strategic interests; a parent operates on unconditional affection.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: Negotiations can fail or be abandoned; parental love is ontological.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The 'Missing Word' in the text is personified as the Savior, bridging the gap between the silence of the Law and the presence of Grace.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activating the 'Golden Calf' as a sensory experience (glistening, touching) to contrast with the 'Invisible Jehovah'.
sterktes.voorbeeld: The golden calf glistened in the desert sun... visible, bright and shining.

risicos.beschrijving: Using 'purchase price' can reduce the relationship with God to a financial transaction.
risicos.voorbeeld: Jesus, who was our purchase price at the gates of hell
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view grace as a paid-off debt rather than a restored relationship.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The Sinai Wilderness (The Mountain vs. The Valley)

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; links Moses' sacrifice to MLK Jr.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Highlighting the 'dash' or 'blank' in the text to show God's emotional pause.
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: God as a Reconciler who waits for a mediator.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Fits strongly with a Call to Repentance or Communion.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a rich tapestry of classical Protestant metaphors. It leans heavily on the Juridical and Economic domains to establish the gravity of sin, but successfully pivots to the Relational domain to provide comfort. The 'Missing Word' serves as a brilliant meta-metaphor for the insufficiency of the Law.

revitalisatie_suggesties.huidige_status: Briefly mentioned as 'serum' and 'antidote' without development.
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Expand on the 'leper's spots' imagery to contrast the external shine of the gold calf with the internal decay of the soul.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The gold was bright on the outside, but the hearts of the dancers were rotting with a fever Moses could not cool.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Use the 'Covenant' concept as a bridgeâ€”a legal contract that is fundamentally a family bond.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Landlords can be evicted or indifferent.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Emphasize that the Landlord built the house specifically for the tenant's joy.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To build on the 'hiding tenant' idea, sin could be described as 'squatting' in a temple meant for God.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful use of CMT to bridge the gap between ancient text and modern existential crisis. The 'Missing Word' device is homiletical genius.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'rhythm' of the 'Shame! Shame!', CMT reveals that this repetition anchors the 'Sin as Weight/Burden' schema.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's learning cycles, CMT shows how the preacher uses the 'Path' schema to move the hearer from Egypt to Sinai to the Cross.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher's power comes from mapping the 'Invisible God' onto the 'Visible Name' of Jesus, making the abstract concrete.

appendices.notities: The preacher uses 'Verticality' (Mountain vs Valley) to establish authority and 'Container' (Book of Life, Household of God) to establish belonging.
